page.title: 14The Manor House, Everleigh
page.content: A manor house has existed on this site since 1560. Prior to this in 1558 it was Crown Land, under Queen Elizabeth I. The house was severly damaged by fire in 1881 but was restored to its present condition and was used as a family residence until 1917. In 1920 it was purchased for use as a convalescent home for young girls. On the outbreak of World War II it was requisitioned as a military hospital for both U.K. and U.S. troops. Since 1942 it has been used by David Bruce Laboratories, formerly called the Emergency Vaccine Laboratory. In 1954 it was purchased by the War Office, hence it reverts to the "Crown" under Queen Elizabeth II.
